definition: butcher/meat merchant
to sell/to betray/to spare no effort/to show off or flaunt
meat/flesh/pulp (of a fruit)/(coll.) (of a fruit) squashy/(of a person) flabby/irresolute/Kangxi radical 130
butcher

sentences.english: The butcher sold bill a pound of lamb.
sentences.chinese: 那個賣肉的賣給比爾一磅羊肉。

sentences.english: The girl sold meat mainly and she tried to sell vegetables on the side.
sentences.chinese: 這姑娘主要賣肉，但另外也試着賣些蔬菜。

sentences.english: She didn't trust the butcher to guarantee their freshness.
sentences.chinese: 她不信任賣肉的人能保證肉食新鮮。

sentences.english: Next time, ask the butcher to bone the meat.
sentences.chinese: 下次讓賣肉的把肉裏的骨頭剔出來。

sentences.english: Will you bone this joint of meat for me?
sentences.chinese: 下次讓賣肉的把肉裏的骨頭剔出來。

sentences.english: A butcher cuts up his meat on a large block of wood.
sentences.chinese: 賣肉的在一塊大木墩上砍肉。

sentences.english: That butcher did you — the meat was under weight.
sentences.chinese: 那個賣肉的人欺騙了你，那塊肉不夠稱。

sentences.english: This butcher often gives customers shout weight.
sentences.chinese: 這個賣肉的經常對顧客缺斤少兩。

definition: (Tw) (coll.) obscene/pornographic
(coll.) experienced and usually well-positioned middle-aged man
lesbian (slang) (loanword)
to work as a good-time girl/to prostitute oneself
lit. dress up as God, play the devil (idiom); fig. to mystify/to deceive people/to scam
to prostitute oneself/to sell oneself into slavery
to face the wall and ponder about one's misdeeds/to stand in the corner (punishment)/(fig.) to examine one's conscience
to throw oneself in sb's arms/to throw oneself at sb
to deserve praise for one's courage (idiom)
soft skin and tender flesh (idiom)/smooth-skinned
to rant and rave/to be scared, upset (Beijing dialect)
rooster/cock/(slang) (Cantonese) to visit a prostitute
bachelor/unmarried man
unable to help however much one would like to (idiom); Although we sympathize, there is no way to help you./My hands are tied.
(slang) rich, good-looking guy
first-rate/excellent (loanword from Japanese 一番, ichiban)
